tit.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳（むさしふちゅうしくまのじんじゃこふん）は、東京都府中市 (東京都)にある上円下方墳である。
sen.e: Musashi Fuchu Kamano Jinja Kofun-Tumulus is a dome-shaped grave mound, located in Fuchu City, Tokyo (Tokyo Prefecture).
Musashi Fuchu Kamano Jinja Kofun-Tumulus is a dome-shaped grave mound, located in Fuchu City, Tokyo (Tokyo Prefecture).
Musashi Fuchu Kamano Jinja Kofun-Tumulus is a dome-shaped grave mound, located in Fuchu City, Tokyo (Tokyo Prefecture).

sen.j: 2005年7月14日、国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: It was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005.
It was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005.
It was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005.

sen.j: 古墳発見と発掘の経緯
sen.e: The Tumulus's Discovery and Excavation History
The Tumulus's Discovery and Excavation History
The Tumulus's Discovery and Excavation History

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳はその名の通り、府中市にある熊野神社の本殿北側敷地内にある。
sen.e: As its appellation suggests, the tumulus is located on the precincts of Kumano-jinja Shrine in Fuchu City, north of its main hall.
As its appellation suggests, the tumulus is located on the precincts of Kumano-jinja Shrine in Fuchu City, north of its main hall.
As its appellation suggests, the tumulus is located on the precincts of Kumano-jinja Shrine in Fuchu City, north of its main hall.

sen.j: 神社の敷地内にある小山が古墳であるという説自体は以前から存在した。
sen.e: Long before its excavation people believed that a mound on the shrine's precincts was a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Long before its excavation people believed that a mound on the shrine's precincts was a tumulus.
Long before its excavation people believed that a mound on the shrine's precincts was a tumulus.

sen.j: 地元では関東大震災の時に墳丘の一部が崩壊するまで石室の中に入れたとの言い伝えもあった。
sen.e: As local legend goes, it was possible to enter the stone chambers until the mound partly collapsed at the Great Kanto Earthquake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As local legend goes, it was possible to enter the stone chambers until the mound partly collapsed at the Great Kanto Earthquake.
As local legend goes, it was possible to enter the stone chambers until the mound partly collapsed at the Great Kanto Earthquake.

sen.j: が、最近まで古墳であるかどうかの確証がつかめなかった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, it was not until recently that the mound was confirmed as a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nevertheless, it was not until recently that the mound was confirmed as a tumulus.
Nevertheless, it was not until recently that the mound was confirmed as a tumulus.

sen.j: なお、熊野神社はもともと府中市内の別の場所にあったものが、1777年（安永6年）に現在の地に移ってきたものと言い伝えられている。
sen.e: As tradition has it, Kumano-jinja Shrine which had been in a different place in Fuchu City was relocated to the present site in 1777.
sen.cmt: 赤字の部分、欠落していたのでwebにより追加しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As tradition has it, Kumano-jinja Shrine which had been in a different place in Fuchu City was relocated to the present site in 1777.
As tradition has it, Kumano-jinja Shrine which had been in a different place in Fuchu City was relocated to the present site in 1777.

sen.j: 古墳と神社は直接的な関係はないものと見られている。
sen.e: It seems therefore that the shrine is not directly related with the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It seems therefore that the shrine is not directly related with the tumulus.
It seems therefore that the shrine is not directly related with the tumulus.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）、熊野神社の祭礼で用いられてきた山車が壊れたために新調することになった。
sen.e: When a float used for the shrine's festivals was broken in 1990, it was decided to create a new one.
When a float used for the shrine's festivals was broken in 1990, it was decided to create a new one.
When a float used for the shrine's festivals was broken in 1990, it was decided to create a new one.

sen.j: そして山車の新調とともに、山車の収納庫も建て替える話が持ち上がった。
sen.e: At the same time it was also planned to rebuilt a shed for a new float.
At the same time it was also planned to rebuilt a shed for the new float.
At the same time it was also planned to rebuilt a shed for the new float.

sen.j: 結局山車の収納庫も神社内にあった小山の一部を削り、規模を拡大して建て替えることになった。
sen.e: The plan resulted in building a larger shed by removing a part of the hillock on the shrine's precincts.
The plan resulted in building a larger shed by removing a part of the hillock on the shrine's precincts.
The plan resulted in building a larger shed by removing a part of the hillock on the shrine's precincts.

sen.j: ところが収納庫の新築に際し、府中市の教育委員会から遺跡の発掘調査の指示が出された。
sen.e: The Fuchu City Board of Education however issued instructions for excavating and studying the remains prior to the construction of the shed.
The Fuchu City Board of Education, however, issued instructions for excavating and studying the remains prior to the construction of the shed.
The Fuchu City Board of Education, however, issued instructions for excavating and studying the remains prior to the construction of the shed.

sen.j: かつて武蔵国の国府が置かれていた府中市内には工事に際して発掘調査が義務付けられている地区があった。
sen.e: Research excavation prior to any construction work was mandatory for certain areas in Fuchu City which used to be the seat of the provincial office of Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Research excavation prior to any construction work was mandatory for certain areas in Fuchu City which used to be the seat of the provincial office of Musashi Province.
Research excavation prior to any construction work was mandatory for certain areas in Fuchu City which used to be the seat of the provincial office of Musashi Province.

sen.j: 熊野神社も調査義務区域内だった。
sen.e: It applied to Kumano-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It applied to Kumano-jinja Shrine.
It applied to Kumano-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 調査の結果、熊野神社敷地内の小山は、土を突き固める版築という方法で築造されたことがわかった。
sen.e: The excavation findings showed that the mound on the shrine's premises had been constructed by the stamped-earth technique called 'hanchiku.'
The excavation findings showed that the mound on the shrine's premises had been constructed by the stamped-earth technique called 'hanchiku.'
The excavation findings showed that the mound on the shrine's premises had been constructed by the stamped-earth technique called 'hanchiku.'

sen.j: また小山からは河原石が大量に見つかった。
sen.e: The mound contained a large amount of river stones.
The mound contained a large amount of river stones.
The mound contained a large amount of river stones.

sen.j: ただ、旧来知られていた高倉古墳群から離れていた。
sen.e: However, it was far away from Takakura burial mounds which had been long known.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was far away from Takakura burial mounds which had been long known.
However, it was far away from Takakura burial mounds which had been long known.

sen.j: 周辺には墳丘に版築工法を用いた古墳が見当たらなかった。
sen.e: Around the site there was no tumulus whose mound was constructed by the hanchiku technique.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around the site there was no tumulus whose mound was constructed by the hanchiku technique.
Around the site there was no tumulus whose mound was constructed by the hanchiku technique.

sen.j: 更には近世の文献で古墳であると指摘したものがなかった。
sen.e: Moreover there was no pre-modern document to suggest that the mound is a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover there was no pre-modern document to suggest that the mound is a tumulus.
Moreover there was no pre-modern document to suggest that the mound is a tumulus.

sen.j: 以上から、発掘後も古墳とはされなかった。
sen.e: For these reasons the mound was not regarded as a tumulus even after its excavation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For these reasons the mound was not regarded as a tumulus even after its excavation.
For these reasons the mound was not regarded as a tumulus even after its excavation.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）、府中市は熊野神社の南東にある高倉古墳群の地中レーダー探査を計画した。
sen.e: In 1994 the City of Fuchu planned to investigate Takakura burial mounds which are located southeast of Kumano-jinja Shrine using an underground radar device.
In 1994 the City of Fuchu planned to investigate Takakura burial mounds which are located southeast of Kumano-jinja Shrine using an underground radar device.
In 1994 the City of Fuchu planned to investigate Takakura burial mounds which are located southeast of Kumano-jinja Shrine using an underground radar device.

sen.j: その中で熊野神社裏手の小山も探査対象の一つに選ばれた。
sen.e: In so doing the mound behind Kumano-jinja Shrine was selected as one of the investigation targets.
In so doing the mound behind Kumano-jinja Shrine was selected as one of the investigation targets.
In so doing the mound behind Kumano-jinja Shrine was selected as one of the investigation targets.

sen.j: レーダー探査の結果、小山の頂上部分から南側にかけて、大きな構造物があることが確認された。
sen.e: As the result of the radar investigation, a large construction was confirmed to exist from the top of the mound to and along the southern side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As the result of the radar investigation, a large construction was confirmed to exist from the top of the mound to and along the southern side.
As the result of the radar investigation, a large construction was confirmed to exist from the top of the mound to and along the southern side.

sen.j: 古墳である可能性が高くなった。
sen.e: It was highly likely that the mound was a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was highly likely that the mound was a tumulus.
It was highly likely that the mound was a tumulus.

sen.j: その後、1884年（明治17年）8月21日に発行された『武蔵野叢誌』第19号という文献に、熊野神社裏手にある塚についての記述があることが発見された。
sen.e: Later it was discovered that the 19th issue of the journal "Musashino Soshi" issued on August 21, 1884 gave an account of a tomb behind Kumano-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 Web版に基づき赤字部分補足しました。
sen.e: The excavation findings showed that the mound on the shrine's premises had been constructed by the hanchiku (A method of making the core of a podium).
The excavation findings showed that the mound on the shrine's premises had been constructed by the hanchiku (A method of making the core of a podium).

sen.j: 1996年には『武蔵野叢誌』に記された熊野神社裏の古い塚についての論文が発表された。
sen.e: In 1996 an article was published on the ancient tomb behind the shrine described in "Musashino Soshi."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1996, an article was published on the ancient tomb behind the shrine, which was described in "Musashino Soshi."
In 1996, an article was published on the ancient tomb behind the shrine, which was described in "Musashino Soshi."

sen.j: 『武蔵野叢誌』には「熊野神社の裏手に古い塚が発見された。
sen.e: "Musashino Soshi" mentions that 'an ancient tomb was discovered behind Kumano-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: Web版に基づき赤字部分補足しました。
sen.e: "Musashino Soshi" mentions that 'an ancient tomb was discovered behind Kumano-jinja Shrine.
"Musashino Soshi" mentions that 'an ancient tomb was discovered behind Kumano-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 塚の入り口は大きな石や滑土（なめつち）で出来ている。
sen.e: The entrance of the tomb is made of big stones and clayey soil.
The entrance of the tomb is made of big stones and clayey soil.
The entrance of the tomb is made of big stones and clayey soil.

sen.j: 中に入ると三つの部屋に分けられている。
sen.e: The inside is divided into three chambers.
The inside is divided into three chambers.
The inside is divided into three chambers.

sen.j: 三室目は大きくて六畳敷くらいの大きさがあり、周囲や天井は全て、滑土を切石状に切り出したものをあたかも眼鏡橋状に組み上げている。
sen.e: The third chamber is as big as a six-mat room, and its surroundings and ceiling are all made of hewn-stone-shaped clayey soil which is built up like a bridge with two semicircular arches.
The third chamber is as big as a six-mat room, and its surroundings and ceiling are all made of hewn-stone-shaped clayey soil which is built up like a bridge with two semicircular arches.
The third chamber is as big as a six-mat room, and its surroundings and ceiling are all made of hewn-stone-shaped clayey soil which is built up like a bridge with two semicircular arches.

sen.j: 中には二体の白骨があり、そばには錆びた釘のようなものが散乱している」。
sen.e: It contains two human skeletons around which rusty-nail-like objects are scattered.'
It contains two human skeletons around which rusty-nail-like objects are scattered.'
It contains two human skeletons around which rusty-nail-like objects are scattered.'

sen.j: などと、古墳の石室内を描写したものと思われる記述が残されていた。
sen.e: Such descriptions in the journal suggest that the author is in fact portraying the interior of a stone chamber of a tumulus.
Such descriptions in the journal suggest that the author in fact portrayed the interior of the stone chambers of the tumulus.
Such descriptions in the journal suggest that the author in fact portrayed the interior of the stone chambers of the tumulus.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）5月、熊野神社の小山の発掘が開始された。
sen.e: In May 2003 the excavation of the mound in Kumano-jinja Shrine began.
In May 2003 the excavation of the mound in Kumano-jinja Shrine began.
In May 2003 the excavation of the mound in Kumano-jinja Shrine began.

sen.j: 発掘後まもなく古墳であることが確認された。
sen.e: It was not long before the excavation confirmed that the mound was a tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was not long before the excavation confirmed that the mound was a tumulus.
It was not long before the excavation confirmed that the mound was a tumulus.

sen.j: 2003年の年末には三段築成の上円下方墳であることが確認された。
sen.e: It further showed by the end of 2003 that the mound was a three-story dome-shaped tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It further showed by the end of 2003 that the mound was a three-story dome-shaped tumulus.
It further showed by the end of 2003 that the mound was a three-story dome-shaped tumulus.

sen.j: 翌2004年（平成16年）には石室内や周辺の発掘が行われた。
sen.e: In 2004 the stone chambers and their surroundings were excavated.
In 2004 the stone chambers and their surroundings were excavated.
In 2004 the stone chambers and their surroundings were excavated.

sen.j: 古墳の立地
sen.e: Location of the Tumulus
Location of the Tumulus
Location of the Tumulus

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳は、多摩川の河岸段丘である府中崖線の北側に広がる、武蔵野台地立川面という台地上に造られた。
sen.e: Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed in Tachikawa Terrace in Musashino Plateau that stretches north of Fuchu Terrace which is a fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.
Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed in Tachikawa Terrace in Musashino Plateau that stretches north of Fuchu Terrace which is a fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.
Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed in Tachikawa Terrace in Musashino Plateau that stretches north of Fuchu Terrace which is a fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.

sen.j: 府中崖線からは約0.5キロメートルの距離があり、古墳の近辺はほぼ平坦である。
sen.e: There is approximately a distance of 0.5 kilometers from Fuchu Terrace and the area surrounding the tumulus is mostly flat.
The tumulus is approximately 0.5 kilometers away from Fuchu Terrace and the area surrounding the tumulus is mostly flat.
The tumulus is approximately 0.5 kilometers away from Fuchu Terrace and the area surrounding the tumulus is mostly flat.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の南東側約1.2キロメートルのところには古墳時代後期の円墳が集まった高倉古墳群。
sen.e: About 1.2 kilometers in the southeast of the tumulus there are Takakura burial mounds which are a cluster of round barrows in the late Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: About 1.2 kilometers in the southeast of the tumulus there are Takakura burial mounds which are a cluster of round barrows in the late Kofun period.
About 1.2 kilometers in the southeast of the tumulus there are Takakura burial mounds which are a cluster of round barrows in the late Kofun period.

sen.j: 南側約0.4キロメートルにもやはり御嶽塚を中心とした古墳時代後期の円墳が集まった群集墳がある。
sen.e: In some 0.4 kilometers to the south of the tumulus there is also a cluster of small tumuli which likewise are round barrows from the late Kofun period and which surrounds Mitakezuka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In some 0.4 kilometers south of the tumulus, there is also a cluster of small tumuli which likewise are round barrows inthe late Kofun period and which surround Mitakezuka.
In some 0.4 kilometers south of the tumulus, there is also a cluster of small tumuli which likewise are round barrows inthe late Kofun period and which surround Mitakezuka.

sen.j: しかし武蔵府中熊野神社古墳のそばには古墳はなく、単独で造られた古墳であると見られている。
sen.e: However, Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus seems to have been built independently of the others as there is no tumulus nearby.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus seems to have been built independently of the others as there is no tumulus nearby.
However, Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus seems to have been built independently of the others as there is no tumulus nearby.

sen.j: ただ、武蔵府中熊野神社古墳と同じ上円下方墳であり、古墳内の構造も似ている天文台構内古墳が約7.5キロメートル東側の三鷹市にある。
sen.e: Having said this, however, there is Tenmondai Konai Kofun-Tumulus which is a dome-shaped tumulus, similar in form and internal structure to Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus, in Mitaka City, some 7.5 kilometers to the east.

Having said this, however, there is Tenmondai Konai Kofun-Tumulus which is a dome-shaped tumulus, similar in form and internal structure to Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus, in Mitaka City, some 7.5 kilometers east of the Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus.

Having said this, however, there is Tenmondai Konai Kofun-Tumulus which is a dome-shaped tumulus, similar in form and internal structure to Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus, in Mitaka City, some 7.5 kilometers east of the Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus.

sen.j: また、西側約9キロメートルに所在する八王子市の北大谷古墳の石室との類似性も指摘されている。
sen.e: As some scholars have pointed out, moreover, the tumulus's stone chambers are similar to the one in Kitaotani Kofun-Tumulus in Hachioji City, some 9 kilometers to the west.

As some scholars have pointed out, moreover, the tumulus's stone chambers are similar to the one in Kitaotani Kofun-Tumulus in Hachioji City, some 9 kilometers west of the Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus.

As some scholars have pointed out, moreover, the tumulus's stone chambers are similar to the one in Kitaotani Kofun-Tumulus in Hachioji City, some 9 kilometers west of the Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の周辺は宅地化が進み、現在、古墳の周辺には空き地がほとんどない状況である。
sen.e: The areas surrounding the tumulus have increasingly become residential and there are few vacant lots around.
The areas surrounding the tumulus have increasingly become residential and there are few vacant lots around.
The areas surrounding the tumulus have increasingly become residential and there are few vacant lots around.

sen.j: 墳丘について
sen.e: Grave Mound
Grave Mound
Grave Mound

sen.j: 三段築成の上円下方墳である。
sen.e: The tumulus is a three-story dome-shaped grave mound.
The tumulus is a three-story dome-shaped grave mound.
The tumulus is a three-story dome-shaped grave mound.

sen.j: 一段目は一辺約32メートル、高さ約0.5メートル。
sen.e: The ground level is about 32 meters on a side and about 0.5 meters in height.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ground level is about 32 meters on a side and about 0.5 meters in height.
The ground level is about 32 meters on a side and about 0.5 meters in height.

sen.j: 二段目は一辺約23メートル、高さ約2.2メートル。
sen.e: The first level is about 23 meters on a side and some 2.2 meters in height.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The first level is about 23 meters on a side and some 2.2 meters in height.
The first level is about 23 meters on a side and some 2.2 meters in height.

sen.j: それぞれ方形をしている。
sen.e: Each is square-shaped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Each is square-shaped.
Each is square-shaped.

sen.j: 三段目は直径約16メートル、高さ約2.1メートルで円形を呈している。
sen.e: The second level is some 16 meters in diameter and about 2.1 meters in height and it is round-shaped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The thrid level is some 16 meters in diameter and about 2.1 meters in height and it is round-shaped.
The thrid level is some 16 meters in diameter and about 2.1 meters in height and it is round-shaped.

sen.j: なお三段目は古墳完成当時は5メートル程度の高さがあったものと推定されている。
sen.e: It has been estimated to be about 5 meters high when it was completed.
It has been estimated to be about 5 meters high when it was completed.
It has been estimated to be about 5 meters high when it was completed.

sen.j: 墳丘は古墳周囲から掘削した土や砂利、そして石室築造時に用いられた軟らかいシルト岩の削り屑などを突き固めて造成する、版築工法で築造されている。
sen.e: The grave mound is constructed by the hanchiku technique with which to stamp down the soil and gravel dug out from the surrounding area, as well as flaky chips of siltstone used to construct the stone chambers.

The grave mound is constructed by the hanchiku technique with which to stamp down the soil and gravel dug out from the surrounding area, as well as flaky chips of siltstone used to construct the stone chambers.

The grave mound is constructed by the hanchiku technique with which to stamp down the soil and gravel dug out from the surrounding area, as well as flaky chips of siltstone used to construct the stone chambers.

sen.j: 一段目の周囲には、石室に使用されたものと同じシルト岩を、40～45センチメートル×35～45センチメートル×15センチメートルに加工した縁石を並べていた。
sen.e: The ground level is lined with kerbs of the same siltstone used for the stone chambers, and each kerb is made into a 40 to 45 cm by 35 to 45 cm by 15 cm cubic.
The ground level is lined with curbs of the same siltstone used for the stone chambers, and each curb measures 40 to 45 centimeters by 35 to 45 centimeters by 15 centimeters.
The ground level is lined with curbs of the same siltstone used for the stone chambers, and each curb measures 40 to 45 centimeters by 35 to 45 centimeters by 15 centimeters.

sen.j: 二段目、三段目には葺石として楕円形の川原石が葺かれている。
sen.e: The first and the second level are covered with oval-shaped river stones.
The first and the second level are covered with oval-shaped river stones.
The first and the second level are covered with oval-shaped river stones.

sen.j: 二段目の葺石が約15センチメートル×10センチメートル大であるのに対して、三段目は二段目よりも大きい約40センチメートル×25センチメートルの石が用いられいる。
sen.e: While covering stones in the first level are about 15cm by 10cm, those in the second level are the larger, approximately 40 cm by 25 cm.

While a covering stone in the first level measures about 15 centimetes by 10 centimetes, a covering stone in the second level is larger than that and measures approximately 40 centimetes by 25 centimetes.

While a covering stone in the first level measures about 15 centimetes by 10 centimetes, a covering stone in the second level is larger than that and measures approximately 40 centimetes by 25 centimetes.

sen.j: 視覚的に二段目の方形部と三段目の円形部を区別している。
sen.e: Thus, the square-shaped first level is visually distinguished from the round-shaped second level.
Thus, the second level of square stones is visually distinguished from the third level of round stones.
Thus, the second level of square stones is visually distinguished from the third level of round stones.

sen.j: また二段目の平坦部には川原石の貼石が敷かれていた。
sen.e: The flat area in the second level are stuck with river stones.
The flat area in the second level is covered with river stones.
The flat area in the second level is covered with river stones.

sen.j: 周濠については墳丘の至近距離からは発見されていない。
sen.e: A surrounding moat has not been discovered near the grave mound.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: No surrounding moats have been discovered near the grave mound.
No surrounding moats have been discovered near the grave mound.

sen.j: が、古墳本体の東側と南側の少し離れた場所から、幅約6メートル、深さが2メートル以上の落ち込みが2ヶ所確認されている。
sen.e: However, two depressions with some 6 meters in width and over 2 meters in depth have been confirmed east and south of and slightly away from the tumulus itself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, two depressions with some 6 meters in width and over 2 meters in depth have been confirmed east and south of and slightly away from the tumulus itself.
However, two depressions with some 6 meters in width and over 2 meters in depth have been confirmed east and south of and slightly away from the tumulus itself.

sen.j: その結果から、一辺およそ90メートルの大きな周濠が存在する可能性がある。
sen.e: These findings suggest that a large surrounding moat with 90 meters on a side may exist.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These findings suggest that a large surrounding moat with 90 meters on a side may exist.
These findings suggest that a large surrounding moat with 90 meters on a side may exist.

sen.j: 古墳の主体部
sen.e: The Main Part of the Tumulus
The Main Part of the Tumulus
The Main Part of the Tumulus

sen.j: 古墳の主体部は複室構造の横穴式石室。
sen.e: The main part of the tumulus is structured into multiple horizontal stone chambers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The main part of the tumulus is structured into multiple horizontal stone chambers.
The main part of the tumulus is structured into multiple horizontal stone chambers.

sen.j: 八の字に開く前庭部と呼ばれる墓前域がある。
sen.e: It has a vestibule shaped like the Japanese figure eight or an open-ended triangle in front of the grave.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has a vestibule shaped like the Japanese figure eight or an open-ended triangle in front of the grave.
It has a vestibule shaped like the Japanese figure eight or an open-ended triangle in front of the grave.

sen.j: そして入り口側から前室、後室、玄室という3室がある。
sen.e: There are three chambers, front, back and burial, starting from the entrance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are three chambers, front, back and burial, starting from the entrance.
There are three chambers, front, back and burial, starting from the entrance.

sen.j: 一段目墳丘上に造営されている。
sen.e: The chambers are constructed in the ground level of the mound.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The chambers are located on the ground level of the mound.
The chambers are located on the ground level of the mound.

sen.j: 石室を築造する前に、東西約8メートル、南北約13メートル以上、そして深さ1.5メートル以上という大きな穴を開けて地表近くの柔らかい土を取り除いた。
sen.e: Before the stone chambers were constructed, soft soil near the surface was removed by digging a large hole with approximately 8 meters from east to west in width, about 13 meters from north to south in length, and over 1.5 meters in depth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before the stone chambers were constructed, soft soil near the surface was removed by digging a large with approximately 8 meters wide from east to west, about 13 meters long from north to south, and over 1.5 meters deep.

Before the stone chambers were constructed, soft soil near the surface was removed by digging a large with approximately 8 meters wide from east to west, about 13 meters long from north to south, and over 1.5 meters deep.

sen.j: そこに関東ローム層の赤土と粘土質の土を、互い違いに5センチメートルほどの厚さで突き固めた。
sen.e: Red clay and clayey soil of the Kanto district was alternately poured into and stamped down in the hole.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Red clay and clayey soil of the Kanto district was alternately poured into the hole and stamped down.
Red clay and clayey soil of the Kanto district was alternately poured into the hole and stamped down.

sen.j: 掘り込み地業と呼ばれる基礎工事が行われていた。
sen.e: This process called 'horikomi chigyo' (digging ground work) was carried out as foundation work.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This process called 'horikomi chigyo' (digging ground work) was carried out as foundation work.
This process called 'horikomi chigyo' (digging ground work) was carried out as foundation work.

sen.j: 掘り込み地業は関東地方の終末期古墳に時々見られるが、1.5メートルもの深さに及ぶものは他にほとんど例がない。
sen.e: Occasionally observed in tumuli from the late to the end of the Kofun period, the tumulus's foundation work is unique in its depth of 1.5 meters.
Occasionally observed in tumuli from the late to the end of the Kofun period, the tumulus's foundation work is unique in its depth of 1.5 meters.
The tumulus's foundation work is unique in its depth of 1.5 meters although it is occasionally observed in tumuli from the late to the end of the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 前半をalthoughで後ろにつけました。

sen.j: 石室の全長は約8.7メートルにおよぶ。
sen.e: The total length of the stone chambers is nearly 8.7 meters.
The total length of the stone chambers is nearly 8.7 meters.
The total length of the stone chambers is nearly 8.7 meters.

sen.j: 前室は方形、後室はややふくらんだ形、玄室は円形に近いふくらみを持っている。
sen.e: While the front chamber is square-shaped, the back chamber is slightly round-shaped and the burial chamber is almost circular in shape.
While the front chamber is square, the back chamber is slightly round and the burial chamber is almost circular in shape.
While the front chamber is square, the back chamber is slightly round and the burial chamber is almost circular in shape.

sen.j: 玄室が丸みを帯びた形の石室は、武蔵の終末期古墳によく見られるもので、胴張り型石室と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Often found in tumuli in Musashi built at the end of the Kofun period, circular burial chambers are called 'drum-shaped stone chamber.'
Circular burial chambers, often found in tumuli in Musash, which were built at the end of the Kofun period, are called 'drum-shaped stone chambers.'
sen.cmt: 不適切訳に対応しました。
sen.e: Circular burial chambers, often found in tumuli in Musash, which were built at the end of the Kofun period, are called 'drum-shaped stone chambers.'

sen.j: 石室にはシルト岩と呼ばれる極めて軟らかい石を使用している。
sen.e: The tumulus's stone chambers are made of silt stone which is extremely soft.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The stone chambers of the tumulus are made of extremely soft silt stones.
The stone chambers of the tumulus are made of extremely soft silt stones.

sen.j: 石の隅を四角形に欠きとって隣の石と組み合わせるという丁寧な石組みを用いて形作られている。
sen.e: Cut into cubic shape, each stone is carefully combined with its neighboring stones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Each stone was cut into cubes and carefully combined with its neighboring stones.
Each stone was cut into cubes and carefully combined with its neighboring stones.

sen.j: シルト岩は多摩川の河岸段丘である府中崖線にも露出している。
sen.e: Silt stones are exposed in Fuchu terrace that belongs to the fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Silt stones are exposed on the Fuchu terrace that belongs to the fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 前置詞誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: Silt stones are exposed on the Fuchu terrace that belongs to the fluvial terrace of Tama-gawa River.

sen.j: 土とほとんど同じくらいの硬さしかないため加工は容易だが、もろくて崩れやすい。
sen.e: They are easy to process as they are as soft as soil although they are fragile and easily susceptible to collapse.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are easy to process as they are as soft as soil although they are fragile and easily susceptible to collapse.
They are easy to process as they are as soft as soil although they are fragile and easily susceptible to collapse.

sen.j: 『武蔵野叢書』にあったように明治時代には開口して玄室まで入れた。
sen.e: As "Musashino Sosho" mentions, the tumulus was open and people could go to as far as the burial chamber in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 なお、『武蔵野叢書』は『武蔵野叢誌』のあやまりかと思われます。
sen.e: As "Musashino Sosho" mentions, the tumulus was open to the public and people could enter the burial chamber in the Meiji period.
As "Musashino Sosho" mentions, the tumulus was open to the public and people could enter the burial chamber in the Meiji period.

sen.j: その後崩落してしまったものと思われる。
sen.e: It seems to have caved in later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It seems to have caved in later.
It seems to have caved in later.

sen.j: 玄室の奥の方からは直径約9センチメートル、深さ約26センチメートルの小土坑が検出された。
sen.e: At the back of the burial chamber a small hole with about 9 centimeters in diameter and some 26 centimeters in depth was detected.
At the back of the burial chamber a small hole with about 9 centimeters in diameter and some 26 centimeters in depth was detected.
At the back of the burial chamber a small hole with about 9 centimeters in diameter and some 26 centimeters in depth was detected.

sen.j: これは石室を築造する際、中軸線を示す基準となる杭を打った穴の跡ではないかと見られている。
sen.e: This is taken as the trace of the hole made by a pile driven to mark the axial line when the chamber was constructed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is taken as the trace of the hole made by a pile driven to mark the axial line when the chamber was constructed.
This is taken as the trace of the hole made by a pile driven to mark the axial line when the chamber was constructed.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳が計画性を持って築造されたことを示している。
sen.e: It suggests that the tumulus was systematically constructed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It suggests that the tumulus was systematically constructed.
It suggests that the tumulus was systematically constructed.

sen.j: 石室の床面には直径10～20センチメートルの多摩川の扁平な川原石が敷かれていた。
sen.e: The camber's floor was covered with flat stones, 10 to 20 centimeters in diameter, taken from Tama-gawa River.
The chamber's floor was covered with flat stones, 10 to 20 centimeters in diameter, which were carried from Tama-gawa River.
The chamber's floor was covered with flat stones, 10 to 20 centimeters in diameter, which were carried from Tama-gawa River.

sen.j: 石の形によっては端の一部を削って形を整え、床一面に石を敷けるように工夫されていた。
sen.e: Depending on their shape, some stones are cut off at the edge so that they can match with others to cover the entire floor.
Depending on their shape, some stones are cut off at the edge so that they can match with others to cover the entire floor.
Depending on their shape, some stones are cut off at the edge so that they can match with others to cover the entire floor.

sen.j: また、玄室の奥壁から「歩兵第一聯隊第一大隊附四名」と書かれた落書きが見つかった。
sen.e: On the back wall of the burial chamber a scribble of 'Four Soldiers of the First Infantry Regiment of the First Battalion' was found.
On the back wall of the burial chamber a scribble of 'Four Soldiers of the First Infantry Regiment of the First Battalion' was found.
On the back wall of the burial chamber a scribble of 'Four Soldiers of the First Infantry Regiment of the First Battalion' was found.

sen.j: これは明治時代、石室が開口していた時代に書かれたものと推定される。
sen.e: This was probably written in the Meiji period when the stone chambers were open.
This was probably written in the Meiji period when the stone chambers were open.
This was probably written in the Meiji period when the stone chambers were open.

sen.j: 出土品について
sen.e: Excavated Articles
Excavated Articles
Excavated Articles

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳は明治時代には開口していたために、古墳内部の副葬品の多くは持ち出されてしまったと思われる。
sen.e: Most of the burial goods inside the tumulus seems to have been taken away as the tumulus was open during the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Most of the burial goods inside the tumulus seem to have been taken away as the tumulus was open during the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 単複誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: Most of the burial goods inside the tumulus seem to have been taken away as the tumulus was open during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 鉄地銀象嵌鞘尻金具1点、刀子4点、鉄釘多数、ガラス球6点が出土したのみである。
sen.e: Only the following articles were excavated: an iron chape inlaid with silver, four small knives (tozu), many iron nails and six glass balls.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Only the following articles were excavated: an iron chape inlaid with silver, four small knives (tozu), many iron nails and six glass balls.
Only the following articles were excavated: an iron chape inlaid with silver, four small knives (tozu), many iron nails and six glass balls.

sen.j: 副葬品はわずかしか出土しなかった。
sen.e: Very few burial goods were unearthed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Very few burial goods were unearthed.
Very few burial goods were unearthed.

sen.j: 鉄釘は玄室から90本、後室からはひとかたまりにまとまった形で55本見つかっている。
sen.e: Ninety iron nails were found in the burial chamber and a bunch of 55 nails was discovered in the back chamber.
Ninety iron nails were found in the burial chamber and a bunch of 55 nails were discovered in the back chamber.
sen.cmt: 単複誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: Ninety iron nails were found in the burial chamber and a bunch of 55 nails were discovered in the back chamber.

sen.j: その他、破片となった鉄釘が216点出土した。
sen.e: Also 216 broken pieces of iron nails were unearthed.
Also 216 broken pieces of iron nails were unearthed.
Also 216 broken pieces of iron nails were unearthed.

sen.j: 鉄釘は主に木棺の止め釘と見られる。
sen.e: Iron nails appear to have been used to close wooden coffins.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Iron nails appear to have been used to close wooden coffins.
Iron nails appear to have been used to close wooden coffins.

sen.j: 初葬時の木棺に用いられた釘などを後室に片付けた後、玄室に追葬の木棺を安置した可能性が高いとされている。
sen.e: It is highly likely that after nails and other things used for the wooden coffins upon the first burial were put away in the back chamber, wooden coffins for additional burials were placed in the burial chamber.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is highly likely that after nails and other things used for the wooden coffins upon the first burial were put away in the back chamber, wooden coffins for additional burials were placed in the burial chamber.

It is highly likely that after nails and other things used for the wooden coffins upon the first burial were put away in the back chamber, wooden coffins for additional burials were placed in the burial chamber.

sen.j: 鉄釘の中には木棺の一部と見られるヒノキ材が付着したものが見られる。
sen.e: Japanese cypress which seems to have been a part of a wooden coffin is attached to some iron nails.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japanese cypress which seems to have been a part of a wooden coffin is attached to some iron nails.
Japanese cypress which seems to have been a part of a wooden coffin is attached to some iron nails.

sen.j: わずかではあるが絹布が付着した鉄釘も見つかっている。
sen.e: Silk is also attached to a tiny fraction of nails.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Silk is also attached to a tiny fraction of nails.
Silk is also attached to a tiny fraction of nails.

sen.j: この点から被葬者は絹布で覆ったヒノキ材の木棺に安置され、埋葬された可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: Based on these points some scholars have suggested that the buried were placed in the wooden coffins covered with silk cloth before they were buried.
Based on these points, some scholars have suggested that the dead persons were placed in the wooden coffins covered with silk cloth before they were buried.
Based on these points, some scholars have suggested that the dead persons were placed in the wooden coffins covered with silk cloth before they were buried.

sen.j: 出土品の中で最も注目されるのは、玄室で発見された鉄地銀象嵌鞘尻金具である。
sen.e: The iron chape inlaid with silver, which was found in the burial chamber, is one of the most noteworthy articles unearthed.
The iron chape inlaid with silver, which was found in the burial chamber, is one of the most noteworthy articles unearthed.
The iron chape inlaid with silver, which was found in the burial chamber, is one of the most noteworthy articles unearthed.

sen.j: 太刀の鞘の先端に付く金具である鉄製の鞘尻金具に、富本銭にも用いられた七曜文などの見事な銀象嵌がほどこされている。
sen.e: The iron chape which is a metal fitting attached to the edge of a sheath is decorated with beautiful silver inlays with the 'Shichiyomon' pattern, which was used for Fuhonsen coin.
The iron chape, which is a metal fitting attached to the edge of a sheath, is decorated with beautiful silver inlays with the 'Shichiyomon' pattern, which was also used for Fuhonsen coins.
The iron chape, which is a metal fitting attached to the edge of a sheath, is decorated with beautiful silver inlays with the 'Shichiyomon' pattern, which was also used for Fuhonsen coins.

sen.j: 他に類を見ないものであった。
sen.e: It is an unprecedented article.
It is an unprecedented article.
It is an unprecedented article.

sen.j: 鞘尻金具の形態などから7世紀後半でも早い時期のものと見られている。
sen.e: It is assumed to have been made at an early stage of the late 7th century based on its shape.
It is assumed to have been made at an early stage of the late 7th century based on its shape.
It is assumed to have been made at an early stage of the late 7th century based on its shape.

sen.j: また、玄室内から被葬者の歯と見られる永久歯が3点発見されている。
sen.e: Three permanent teeth which appears to have belonged to the buried were found in the burial chamber.
Three permanent teeth which appear to have belonged to the buried were found in the burial chamber.
sen.cmt: 単複誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: Three permanent teeth which appear to have belonged to the buried were found in the burial chamber.

sen.j: いずれの歯も壮年期の初期か前半期のものである。
sen.e: They are all at the beginning or early stage of mature age.
They belonged to a person at the beginning or the early stage of mature age.
They belonged to a person at the beginning or the early stage of mature age.

sen.j: 古墳の副葬品とは直接関係はないが、石室内から寛永通宝、文久永宝、1銭、10銭、半銭など117枚の銭貨が見つかっている。
sen.e: Some 117 coins including Kanei Tsuho, Bunkyu Eiho, 1 sen, 10 sen, and 0.5 sen were found in the stone chambers although they have no direct relationship with the burial articles in the tumulus.
Some 117 coins including Kanei Tsuho, Bunkyu Eiho, 1 sen, 10 sen, and 0.5 sen were found in the stone chambers although they have no direct relationship with the burial articles in the tumulus.
Some 117 coins including Kanei Tsuho, Bunkyu Eiho, 1 sen, 10 sen, and 0.5 sen were found in the stone chambers although they have no direct relationship with the burial articles in the tumulus.

sen.j: また玄室の奥には祭壇状の石積があって、灯明皿と燭台も出土している。
sen.e: In the back of the burial chamber stones are piled in the form of altar, and a candle dish and candlestand were also excavated.
There are stones piled like an altar at the back of the burial chamber, and a candle dish and a candlestand were excavated.
There are stones piled like an altar at the back of the burial chamber, and a candle dish and a candlestand were excavated.

sen.j: これはかつて武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の石室が開口していた時代、熊野神社の奥宮として信仰の場となっていたものと考えられる。
sen.e: This may suggest that the stone chambers were used for a place of worship as the inner shrine of Kumano-jinja Shrine when they were opened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This may suggest that the stone chambers were used for worship as the inner shrine of Kumano-jinja Shrine when they were open to the public.
This may suggest that the stone chambers were used for worship as the inner shrine of Kumano-jinja Shrine when they were open to the public.

sen.j: 出土した銭貨は賽銭とみられる。
sen.e: The unearthed coins are probably money offerings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The unearthed coins are probably money offerings.
The unearthed coins are probably money offerings.

sen.j: 古墳の特徴
sen.e: Characteristics of the Tumulus
Characteristics of the Tumulus
Characteristics of the Tumulus

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の特徴は、まず上円下方墳という墳形である。
sen.e: One of the characteristics of the tumulus is its dome-like shape.
One of the characteristics of the tumulus is a tomb with a dome-shaped mound on a square base.
One of the characteristics of the tumulus is a tomb with a dome-shaped mound on a square base.

sen.j: 現在のところ発掘調査によって正式に確認されている上円下方墳は、武蔵府中熊野神社古墳を含めて全国で5例しかなく、きわめて稀少な墳形である。
sen.e: The dome-shaped tumuli as officially confirmed by research excavations at the present amount to only five in Japan, including the tumulus under consideration, and are therefore very rare.
The dome-shaped tumuli as officially confirmed by research excavations at the present amount to only five in Japan, including the tumulus under consideration, and are therefore very rare.

At present, tombs with a dome-shaped mound on a square base officially confirmed through research excavations amount to only five in Japan, including the tumulus under consideration, and are therefore very rare.
sen.cmt: as officially confirmed→ officially confirmedat the present→at present

sen.j: また武蔵府中熊野神社古墳は、現在正式確認されている上円下方墳の中では最大のものである。
sen.e: The tumulus is the largest of all the officially confirmed dome-shaped tumuli.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus is the largest of all the officially confirmed tombs with a dome-shaped mound on a square base.
The tumulus is the largest of all the officially confirmed tombs with a dome-shaped mound on a square base.

sen.j: 葺石の存在や、高度な石組み技術で胴張り型石室が形作られている点、副葬された鉄地銀象嵌鞘尻金具などから、先進的な畿内の政権と密接な繋がりを持つ、武蔵国の有力な在地勢力が造営したものと見られている。
sen.e: Judging from the presence of the paved stones, the construction of the drum-shaped stone chambers through the advanced stone-building technique, and the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, we may assume that it was constructed by an important local power in Musashi Province who had a close connection with the progressive Kinai government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Judging from the presence of the paved stones, the construction of the drum-shaped stone chambers through the advanced stone-building technique, and the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, we may assume that it was constructed by an important local power in Musashi Province who had a close connection with the progressive Kinai government.

Judging from the presence of the paved stones, the construction of the drum-shaped stone chambers through the advanced stone-building technique, and the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, we may assume that it was constructed by an important local power in Musashi Province who had a close connection with the progressive Kinai government.

sen.j: 複室胴張り形の石室は、多摩地域の終末期古墳の中でも他の古墳を規模的に大きく上回る古墳に共通して採用されている。
sen.e: Drum-shaped stone chambers are commonly adopted by the larger tumuli in Tama region from the end of the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Drum-shaped stone chambers are commonly adopted in the larger tumuli in the Tama region at the end of the Kofun period.
Drum-shaped stone chambers are commonly adopted in the larger tumuli in the Tama region at the end of the Kofun period.

sen.j: この点からも武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の被葬者が有力な在地勢力であったことは明らかである。
sen.e: Similarly, this clearly suggests that Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed by an important local power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Similarly, this clearly suggests that Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed by an important local power.
Similarly, this clearly suggests that Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was constructed by an important local power.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳からは土器が出土していないため、築造年代の推定は難しい。
sen.e: It is difficult to estimate when the tumulus was built since no earthenware was found in it
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is difficult to estimate when the tumulus was built since no earthenware were found in it
sen.cmt: 単複誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: It is difficult to estimate when the tumulus was built since no earthenware were found in it

sen.j: 近隣にある古墳の石室との比較、副葬品の鉄地銀象嵌鞘尻金具などから、7世紀中葉から後半にかけて造営されたと思われる。
sen.e: When comparing it with the stone chambers in the neighboring tumuli and considering the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, it seems that the tumulus was built from the mid to the late 7th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When comparing the stone chambers with those in the neighboring tumuli and considering the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, it seems that the tumulus was built from the mid to the late 7th century.
sen.cmt: 単複誤りに対応しました。
sen.e: When comparing the stone chambers with those in the neighboring tumuli and considering the iron chape with silver inlays among the burial articles, it seems that the tumulus was built from the mid to the late 7th century.

sen.j: 追葬がなされていると見られる点から、初葬は7世紀中ごろ、追葬が7世紀後半になるとの推定もある。
sen.e: Considering the fact that additional burials have been identified, some estimate that the first burials were made in the mid 7th century and the additional burials in the late 7th century.
Considering the fact that additional burials have been identified, some estimate that the first burials were made in the mid 7th century and the additional burials in the late 7th century.
Considering the fact that additional burials have been identified, some estimate that the first burials were made in the mid 7th century and the additional burials in the late 7th century.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳造営当時の古墳近隣の情勢を考察すると、7世紀中葉以降とされる造営時期が大きな意味を持ってくる。
sen.e: The construction period of the mid 7th century onwards gains significance in connection with the historical situation around the tumulus at the time of its building.
The construction period of the mid 7th century onwards gains significance in connection with the historical situation around the tumulus at the time of its building.
The construction period of the mid 7th century onwards gains significance in connection with the historical situation around the tumulus at the time of its building.

sen.j: すなわち、古墳造営と前後して古墳東方約1キロメートルのところに東山道武蔵路が開かれたとみられる。
sen.e: Which is to say, around the time of its construction, Tosando Musashi-michi Road was opened about 1 kilometer to the east.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Which is to say, around the time of its construction, Tosando Musashi-michi Road was built about 1 kilometer east of the tumulus.
Which is to say, around the time of its construction, Tosando Musashi-michi Road was built about 1 kilometer east of the tumulus.

sen.j: 7世紀末から8世紀初頭にかけては、現在の府中市中心部に武蔵国府が設置されたと考えられる。
sen.e: From the end of the 7th century to the early 8th century, Musashi Province was established at the center of the present Fuchu City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the end of the 7th century to the early 8th century, Musashi Kokufu (provincial office of Musashi Province under the ritsuryo system) was established at the center of the present Fuchu City.
From the end of the 7th century to the early 8th century, Musashi Kokufu (provincial office of Musashi Province under the ritsuryo system) was established at the center of the present Fuchu City.

sen.j: そのため在地の有力者であった武蔵府中熊野神社古墳の被葬者が、武蔵国府が現府中市に設置されるにあたって重要な役割を果たしたのではないかとの説が有力である。
sen.e: For these reasons the following theory has been regarded as cogent that the buried in the tumulus who were local powers played an important part in establishing Musashi Province in the present Fuchu City.
For these reasons, there is a cogent theory that states that the buried in the tumulus were local powers who played an important part in establishing Musashi Kokufu in the present Fuchu City.
For these reasons, there is a cogent theory that states that the buried in the tumulus were local powers who played an important part in establishing Musashi Kokufu in the present Fuchu City.

sen.j: 武蔵府中熊野神社古墳は日本国内でもまれな上円下方墳であり、当時の武蔵国最大級の古墳で、古墳造営直後には近隣に武蔵国府が設置されるなど、古墳の考古学的価値と並んで社会的に見ても貴重な遺跡であることが評価され、2005年（平成17年）7月14日、国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005 for the following reasons: it is a rare dome-shaped tumulus in Japan; it is one of the largest tumuli built in the ancient Musashi Province; and it is archaeologically and sociologically valuable remains since Musashi Province was established nearby immediately after its construction.

Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005 for the following reasons: it is a rare tomb with a dome-shaped mound on a square base in Japan; it is one of the largest tumuli built in the ancient Musashi Province; and it is archaeologically and sociologically valuable remains since Musashi Fokufu was established nearby immediately after its construction.

Musashi Fuchu Kumano Jinja Tumulus was designated as a national historical site on July 14, 2005 for the following reasons: it is a rare tomb with a dome-shaped mound on a square base in Japan; it is one of the largest tumuli built in the ancient Musashi Province; and it is archaeologically and sociologically valuable remains since Musashi Fokufu was established nearby immediately after its construction.

sen.j: 古墳の保存と公開
sen.e: Preservation and Public Viewing
Preservation and Opening to the Public
Preservation and Opening to the Public

sen.j: 現在、武蔵府中熊野神社古墳は保存活用整備事業中。
sen.e: At the time of writing, the tumulus was under preservation and preparation was being made for its cultural usage.
sen.cmt: 「現在」は2008年度以前を示すので、「執筆時には」とし、以下過去形を使用しました。
sen.e: At the time of writing, the tumulus was under preservation and preparation was being made for its cultural usage.
At the time of writing, work was underway to preserve the tumulus and preparations were being made to ready it for cultural usage.

sen.j: 周囲にはフェンスが張られ、墳丘全体にシートがかけられて遺跡が保護されている。
sen.e: It was surrounded by fences and the entire mound was covered with a sheet to protect the remains.
It was surrounded by fences and the entire mound was covered with a sheet to protect the remains.
It was surrounded by fences and the entire mound was covered with sheeting to protect the remains.

sen.j: 整備が終了する2008年（平成20年）度末には公開が予定されている。
sen.e: At the end of the fiscal year 2008 it was scheduled to be made available for public viewing.
It was scheduled to open the tumulus to the public when the maintenance completed at the end of the fiscal year 2008.
The opening of the tumulus to the public was scheduled for when the maintenance was completed at the end of fiscal 2008.
